page.title: 09AN INTERVIEW WITH A FARMER
page.content: Mr.Winford Phillips lives on a farm which is situated on the site of an old fort.He has resided in the locality since birth and purchased his present farm in 1939.It is called GRONLLWYN and he believes that the name derives from "the circle surrounded by trees".It is preserved as an ancient monument. It is a comparatively small farm of 120 acres with dairy and beef cattle and some sheep. When purchased the quality of the land was poor but it has gradually been improved and cultivated to a much better standard, in earlier days using such laborious methods as travelling with horse and cart to the lime kilns of Haverfordwest <a town 16 miles away> and spreading the lime with hand tools,to the more sophisticated methods of mechanical farming today.
